meanings.definition: Relating to the study of ancient ecosystems.
meanings.sent1: The paleoecologic research focused on understanding how prehistoric environments functioned.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use paleoecologic data to learn about the ecosystems of the past.
meanings.sent3: The paleoecologic investigation revealed surprising details about the ancient habitats.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a paleoecologic treasure trove, full of knowledge about ancient ecosystems.
meanings.sent5: The paleoecologic study painted a vivid picture of the prehistoric world.

meanings.definition: Involving the analysis of past environmental conditions.
meanings.sent1: The paleoecologic examination provided insights into historical environmental changes.
meanings.sent2: Researchers rely on paleoecologic methods to understand past climates.
meanings.sent3: The paleoecologic approach to history made the students see the world in a new light.
meanings.sent4: His words carried a paleoecologic weight, revealing the secrets of bygone environments.
meanings.sent5: The paleoecologic perspective offered a unique view of the environmental past.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the ecological history of a specific region.
meanings.sent1: The paleoecologic changes in the area influenced the diversity of species.
meanings.sent2: Local flora and fauna are shaped by paleoecologic events from centuries ago.
meanings.sent3: The paleoecologic story of the forest was both fascinating and informative.
meanings.sent4: His knowledge of the paleoecologic past of the valley was unmatched.
meanings.sent5: The paleoecologic connection to the land was evident in the ancient rock formations.
